About Me

I'm a software engineer living in Montevideo, Uruguay currently working at tarmac.

I did my degree at the University of the Republic, and I have 10+ years of experience as a developer, learning while I work with great people.

I really encourage best practices, and I think that there are always new things to learn.

I really enjoy playing videogames, the ocassional boardgame, and going to the movies anytime.

I'm a Music enthusiast, and I try to make a humble contribution by playing drums. From my personal point of view, I think there's a soundtrack for every moment in life.

Music enthusiast
Videogame addict
Trashball pro player
Amazon shopaholic

Developer Tools

Over the years I've been trying different dev tools in order to make my life easier/prettier while working. Here is a list of the Developer tools I like the most.


VS Code

I've been jumping a lot between editors and for me, VS Code is the best choise out there. It's a great editor with a great community and tons of usefull extensions to add.

warp

This is by far the best terminal option out there. Warp is a fully native, GPU-accelerated, Rust-based terminal, it's currently in beta and onnly has support for Mac, but you should try it if able.

GitKraken

Powerful graphical interface for Git as an alternative to the command line. If you're tired of typing the same commands over and over, this is the best option to take.

DBeaver

Free, open source, graphical database management tool for database. Easy to use and super helpful in times of need.

Insomnia

Free Cross-Platform Desktop Framework for building and using APIs. For graphql APIs in particular this one takes the first place.
